ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Respondent
VR scenario number
VR scenario order
It was hard to understand things from his/her point of view.
Notes: 0 = Do not agree at all ; 100 = Completely agree; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: I could understand his/her side of a disagreement before I make a decision.
Notes: 0 = Do not agree at all ; 100 = Completely agree; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: I can understand him/her better by imagining how things look from his perspective.
Notes: 0 = Do not agree at all ; 100 = Completely agree; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: I don't need to waste much time listening to his/her arguments.
Notes: 0 = Do not agree at all ; 100 = Completely agree; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: There are two sides to our interaction, and I can look at them both.
Notes: 0 = Do not agree at all ; 100 = Completely agree; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: If I'm mad at him/her, I can "put myself in his/her shoes" for a while.
Notes: 0 = Do not agree at all ; 100 = Completely agree; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: VR Perspective Taking Scale - Mean Score
Notes: Average all 7 items. Scores for q1 and q4 scored in reverse (inverted). For example, if q1 score is 60, use 40 in the total score calculations; 777 = incomplete; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Before criticizing him/her, I can understand how I would feel if I were in his/her place.
Notes: 0 = Do not agree at all ; 100 = Completely agree; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Were any of the characters trying to be mean to you?
Did anything happen that bothered you?
Did any of the characters make you happy?
Did any of the characters make you upset?
Would you be mad if this happened in real life?
Would you try to hit someone else if this happened in real life?
Would you yell at someone else if this happened in real life?

VR scene number
